profile_data.summary:
CAREER SUMMARY
• Software Engineer with a Ph.D. and 14+ years of industry-related experience taking on Research Engineer, Applied Researcher and Senior Leadership roles.
• I have worked on pure as well as applied research, and have engineered systems that were deployed in production to billions of users.
• I have open-sourced software releases (ai-economist, warp-drive, and the climate co-operation competition) with over 1500 stars and 300 forks.
• I have authored publications and patents with over 1300 citations (https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=-F8394IAAAAJ&hl=en).
• I am broadly interested in machine learning (ML) modeling, specifically using Large Models (LM) and deep reinforcement learning (RL). My focus areas include Personalization and Recommendation, LLMs, Distributed Multi-Agent RL Training, Contextual and Sequential Decision Making, Optimization, and Counterfactual Offline Learning.

SKILLS
LLMs, Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning (RL), Distributed RL Training, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Optimization

experience.description: I tackle some of the most challenging problems at Comcast using ML/AI. I develop algorithms in machine/deep/reinforcement learning and help build a large scale system to deploy models at Comcast scale (10s of millions of customers). Employed classical as well as RL techniques to improve various facets of customer service experiences such as automatically detecting and repairing outages before they happen, and finding the best solutions to customer questions and issues.

publications.name: The AI Economist: Taxation policy design via two-level deep multiagent reinforcement learning
publications.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) and reinforcement learning (RL) have improved many areas but are not yet widely adopted in economic policy design, mechanism design, or economics at large. The AI Economist is a two-level, deep RL framework for policy design in which agents and a social planner coadapt. In particular, the AI Economist uses structured curriculum learning to stabilize the challenging two-level, coadaptive learning problem. We validate this framework in the domain of taxation. In one-step economies, the AI Economist recovers the optimal tax policy of economic theory. In spatiotemporal economies, the AI Economist substantially improves both utilitarian social welfare and the trade-off between equality and productivity over baselines. It does so despite emergent tax-gaming strategies while accounting for emergent labor specialization, agent interactions, and behavioral change. These results demonstrate that two-level, deep RL complements economic theory and unlocks an AI-based approach to designing and understanding economic policy.

publications.name: Using AI to Improve the Customer Experience: A Virtual Assistant Chatbot
publications.description:
AI and Machine Learning (ML) are becoming pervasive, allowing new applications for chatbots.
This paves the way for operational transformations in the field of the cable telecommunication
industry, where chatbots will soon be able to field some customer contacts to solve their issues in
real-time -- thereby reducing waiting queues while enhancing service quality, informed by
consistent answers and considering all available network information in real time.
This article describes the steps service providers can use to build such a chatbot. It and drills into
the AI/ML elements in charge of performing installation diagnostics, predicting the behavior of
the systems and users, and pinpointing the root causes critical to fixing issues before they even
become visible to customers. These highly specialized AI/ML algorithms feed their propositions
into a decision engine (DE), so as to understand a much larger context, and apply game theory to
make optimal choices for the customer.

publications.name: On Optimizing Operational Efficiency in Storage Systems Via Deep Reinforcement Learning
publications.publisher: European Conference on Machine Learning and Principles and Practice of Knowledge Discovery in Databases (ECML-PKDD)
publications.description:
This paper deals with the application of deep reinforcement
learning to optimize the operational efficiency of a solid state storage
rack. Specifically, we train an on-policy and model-free policy gradient
algorithm called the Advantage Actor-Critic (A2C). We deploy a dueling
deep network architecture to extract features from the sensor readings
off the rack and devise a novel utility function that is used to control
the A2C algorithm. Experiments show performance gains greater than
30% over the default policy for deterministic as well as random data
workloads.

publications.name: A K-fold method for Baseline Estimation in Policy Gradient Algorithms
publications.publisher: NIPS Workshop on Deep Reinforcement Learning
publications.description:
The high variance issue in unbiased policy-gradient methods such as VPG and
REINFORCE is typically mitigated by adding a baseline. However, the baseline
fitting itself suffers from the underfitting or the overfitting problem. In this paper,
we develop a K-fold method for baseline estimation in policy gradient algorithms.
The parameter K is the baseline estimation hyperparameter that can adjust the
bias-variance trade-off in the baseline estimates. We demonstrate the usefulness of
our approach via two state-of-the-art policy gradient algorithms on three MuJoCo
locomotive control tasks.
